Package gameobjects.nonstaticobjects.monsters

Class Monster

java.lang.Object
gameobjects.GameObject
gameobjects.nonstaticobjects.NonStaticObject
gameobjects.nonstaticobjects.monsters.Monster
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Clotty, FlyingMonster, Gurdy, Lamb, Spider, SummoningMonster, Vis
public abstract class Monster
extends NonStaticObject
A Monster is a NonStaticObject, it uses different variables such as, a integer variable attackSpeed, that represents the speed the Monster will be able to damage the hero.

Another one is the double forwardDistance, that is the distance from the hero, that will make the Monster move forwards.

The last one is the double backwardDistance, that is the distance from the hero, that will make the Monster move backwards.

Because the Monster can also attack from a certain distance, there's another constructor that holds some other variable, such as a double shootingDistance that represents the distance between the hero and the monster, that the monster will start shooting a projectile at the hero.

The next unique variable is a double, reach, used to know how far the projectile should go. And, is a double, distantAttackSpeed, used to know how fast the DistantMonster can shoot.

Creating a Monster

Here's an example to create a Monster that only attacks hand to hand : 

 Monster monster = new Monster(new Vector2(0.5, 0.5), new Vector2(0.1,0.1), "image/monster", 
 0.2, 1, 5, currentRoom, 50, 0.5, 0);

Here's an example to create a Monster that can distantly attack : 

 Monster monster = new Monster(new Vector2(0.5, 0.5), new Vector2(0.1,0.1), "image/monster", 
 0.2, 1, 5, currentRoom, 50, 0.5, 0, 0.7, 0.3, 50);
To check what the other variable from Monster are please refer to NonStaticObject and GameObject.

  • Constructor Details

    • Monster

      public Monster​(Vector2 position, Vector2 size, java.lang.String imagePath, double speed, int damage, int health, Room room, int attackSpeed, double forwardDistance, double backwardDistance)
      Constructs a new Monster, whose position and size are specified by the Vector2 argument and whose room is specified by the Room argument.

      Here forwardDistance, backwardDistance and shootingDistance are all the referring to the distance from the DistantMonster and the Hero.

      Parameters:
      position - the position of the new Monster
      size - the size of the new Monster
      imagePath - the image of the new Monster
      speed - the speed of the new Monster
      damage - the damage done by the new Monster
      health - the health of the new Monster
      room - the room the new Monster will be in
      attackSpeed - the speed to which the new Monster will attack on hand to hand
      forwardDistance - the distance that the new Monster will start moving forward
      backwardDistance - the distance that the new Monster will start moving backward

    • Monster

      public Monster​(Vector2 position, Vector2 size, java.lang.String imagePath, double speed, int damage, int health, Room room, int attackSpeed, double forwardDistance, double backwardDistance, double shootingDistance, double reach, int distantAttackSpeed)
      Constructs a new Monster that can distantly attack, whose position and size are specified by the Vector2 argument and whose room is specified by the Room argument.

      Here forwardDistance, backwardDistance and shootingDistance are all the referring to the distance from the DistantMonster and the Hero.

      Parameters:
      position - the position of the new Monster
      size - the size of the new Monster
      imagePath - the image of the new Monster
      speed - the speed of the new Monster
      damage - the damage done by the new Monster
      health - the health of the new Monster
      room - the room the new Monster will be in
      attackSpeed - the speed to which the new Monster will attack on hand to hand
      forwardDistance - the distance that the new Monster will start moving forward
      backwardDistance - the distance that the new Monster will start moving backward
      shootingDistance - the distance that the new Monster will start shooting at the hero
      reach - the reach for the projectile shot by the new Monster
      distantAttackSpeed - the speed to which the new Monster will attack by shooting

    • Monster

      public Monster​(Vector2 position, Vector2 size, java.lang.String imagePath, double speed, int damage, int health, Room room, int attackSpeed, double forwardDistance, double backwardDistance, double shootingDistance, double reach, int distantAttackSpeed, java.util.List<java.lang.String> tearAnimationSprite, java.lang.String tearImagePath)
      Constructs a new Monster that can distantly attack, whose position and size are specified by the Vector2 argument and whose room is specified by the Room argument.

      Here forwardDistance, backwardDistance and shootingDistance are all the referring to the distance from the DistantMonster and the Hero.

      This constructor specifies the Tear image Animation with a List of String. An the Initial Tear image.

      Parameters:
      position - the position of the new Monster
      size - the size of the new Monster
      imagePath - the image of the new Monster
      speed - the speed of the new Monster
      damage - the damage done by the new Monster
      health - the health of the new Monster
      room - the room the new Monster will be in
      attackSpeed - the speed to which the new Monster will attack on hand to hand
      forwardDistance - the distance that the new Monster will start moving forward
      backwardDistance - the distance that the new Monster will start moving backward
      shootingDistance - the distance that the new Monster will start shooting at the hero
      reach - the reach for the projectile shot by the new Monster
      distantAttackSpeed - the speed to which the new Monster will attack by shooting
      tearAnimationSprite - the tear animation used when it dies
      tearImagePath - the tear initial image

  • Method Details

    • updateGameObject

      public void updateGameObject()
      Updates the Monster based on the distance between it and the Hero.

      If the Hero distance is bigger or equal than the forward distance it moves forwards. If the Hero distance is smaller or equal than the backward distance it moves backwards. If the Hero distance is smaller or equal than the shooting distance the Monster shoots at the Hero.

      If the hand to hand timer is equal to 0, it launches the Monster#attackHero(Hero) function.

      Also decreases the hand to hand timer if it's not 0.
